es.upm.dit.gsi.gsilejos.lejos.robotics

Class RegulatedMotor

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.upm.dit.gsi.gsilejos.lejos.robotics.RegulatedMotor

  • public class RegulatedMotor
extends Object
    Simulates the Lejos RegulatedMotor for the simulator Be careful, some methods are unimplemented
    Author:
    amardomingo

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegulatedMotor

        public RegulatedMotor()
        Constructor. Default speed is 2 (0.2 in simbad). Default direction is 2 (right, as stated in the algorithm). Default move value is 0.

    • Method Detail

      • setMotor

        public void setMotor(DifferentialPilot piloto,
            byte direction)
        Setter. Sets the pilot the simulator belongs to, and its direction SIMULATOR ONLY
        Parameters:
        piloto -
        direction -

      • forward

        public void forward()
             throws IllegalStateException
        Starts the motor at the speed given for the variable 'speed' It will turn to one direction or another depending of the value of the 'direction' variable.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the pilot is already moving

      • backward

        public void backward()
        Starts the motor at the speed given for the variable 'speed' It will turn to one direction or another depending of the value of the 'direction' variable. Is opposite to 'forward()'
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the pilot is already moving

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the motor, and set 'moving' to false

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Returns the 'moving' variable
        Returns:
        true if the motor is on the move

      • rotateTo

        public void rotateTo(int limitAngle)
        Rotates the pilot to the position given as argument
        Parameters:
        limitAngle - - Angle to be rotated to.

      • rotateTo

        public void rotateTo(int limitAngle,
            boolean immediateReturn)
        Runs the 'rotateTo' method in a separate Thread Experimental

      • rotate

        public void rotate(int angle)
        Rotate the pilot the angle given as parameters
        Parameters:
        angle - - Angle to rotate.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(int angle,
          boolean immediateReturn)
        Runs the 'rotate(angle)' method in a separated Thread Experimental

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int speed)
        Setter Sets the speed of the motor
        Parameters:
        speed - int representing the speed of the pilot

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Getter Return the motor speed, regardless of it being stop or in moventent
        Returns:
        speed int with the motor speed

        public double getRotationSpeed()
        Getter Return the same value as getSpeed()
        Returns:
